sen.j: 岩倉 乗具（いわくら のりとも、寛文6年8月29日 (旧暦)（1666年9月27日） - 享保15年8月23日 (旧暦)（1730年10月4日））は、江戸時代前期から中期の公卿。
sen.e: Noritomo IWAKURA (September 27, 1666 - October 4, 1730) was a Kugyo (the top court officials) in the period from the early period through the middle period of the Edo period.
Noritomo IWAKURA (September 27, 1666 - October 4, 1730) was a Kugyo (top court official) during the early through the middle of the Edo period.
Noritomo IWAKURA (September 27, 1666 - October 4, 1730) was a Kugyo (top court official) during the early through the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 霊元天皇（112代）東山天皇（113代）中御門天皇（114代）の三代にわたり朝廷に仕え、官位は正二位権大納言まで昇った。
sen.e: He served to Imperial Court through 3 generations of Emperors, which are Emperor Reigen (112th), Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and Emperor Nakamikado (114th), and his court rank was raised up to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).

He served the Imperial Court through three generations of Emperors, which are Emperor Reigen (112th), Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and Emperor Nakamikado (114th), and his court rank was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).

He served the Imperial Court through three generations of Emperors, which are Emperor Reigen (112th), Emperor Higashiyama (113th), and Emperor Nakamikado (114th), and his court rank was raised to Shonii (Senior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 父は千種有維（従二位権大納言）。
sen.e: His father was Arikore CHIGUSA (Junii (Junior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon).
His father was Arikore CHIGUSA (Junii - Junior Second Rank - Gon Dainagon).
His father was Arikore CHIGUSA (Junii [Junior Second Rank], Gon Dainagon).

sen.j: 養父は岩倉具詮（従二位参議）。
sen.e: His adoptive father was Tomoaki IWAKURA (Junii Sangi (councillor)).
His adoptive father was Tomoaki IWAKURA (Junii Sangi - councillor).
His adoptive father was Tomoaki IWAKURA (Junii, Sangi [councilor]).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 子に岩倉恒具、千種有敬、植松賞雅がいる。
sen.e: He had Tsunetomo IWAKURA, Arinori CHIGUSA, and Takamasa UEMATSU as his children.
His children were Tsunetomo IWAKURA, Arinori CHIGUSA, and Takamasa UEMATSU.
His children were Tsunetomo IWAKURA, Arinori CHIGUSA, and Takamasa UEMATSU.

sen.j: 千種家の嫡男だったが、千種家は岩倉家の分家筋にあたるため、子のない本家の岩倉具詮の養子に入って岩倉家を継いだ。
sen.e: He was the legitimate son of the Chigusa family, but since the Chigusa family was a branch family of the Iwakura family and the IWAKURA family didn't have any children, he became as an adopted child of Tomoaki IWAKURA and inherited the IWAKURA family.

He was the legitimate son of the Chigusa family, but since it was a branch of the Iwakura family that didn't have any children, he became as an adopted child of Tomoaki IWAKURA and inherited the IWAKURA family.

He was the legitimate son of the Chigusa family, but since it was a branch of the Iwakura family that didn't have any children, he became an adopted child of Tomoaki IWAKURA and inherited the IWAKURA family.
sen.cmt: became an adopted child としました。

sen.e: His original name was Tomomune (具統).
His original name was Tomomune (具統).
His original name was Tomomune (具統).

sen.j: 延宝8年（1680年）に元服とともに叙爵。
sen.e: In 1680, along with genpuku (celebrate one's coming of age), he was conferred a peerage.
In 1680, along with genpuku (celebration of one's coming of age), he was conferred a peerage.
In 1680, along with his coming-of-age ceremony, he was conferred a peerage.
sen.cmt: 元服 の表現を英語のみとしました。

sen.j: 以降、右少将や右中将などの官職をつとめた。
sen.e: After that, he served in government post such as Ushosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Uchujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処です
sen.e: After that, he served in a government post such as Ushosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of the Inner Palace Guards), Uchujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and so on.

After that, he served in a government post such as Ushosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of the Inner Palace Guards), Uchujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and so on.

sen.j: 官位も累進し、元禄16年（1703年）には従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: His official court rank advanced, too, and in 1703, he was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and became to be counted as one of Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処です
sen.e: His official court rank advanced too and in 1703, he was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and was counted as one of the Kugyo.
His official court rank advanced too and in 1703, he was conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and was counted as one of the Kugyo.

sen.j: 宝永4年（1707年）には具偈と改名し、参議となった。
sen.e: In 1707, he changed his name to 具偈, and became as Sangi (councillor).
In 1707, he changed his name to 具偈, and became Sangi (councillor).
In 1707, he changed his name to 具偈, and became Sangi (councilor).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 正徳 (日本)3年（1713年）に従二位権中納言。
sen.e: In 1713, he became as Junii Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
In 1713, he became Junii Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
In 1713, he became Junii Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: 享保4年（1719年）に乗具と改名。
sen.e: In 1719, he changed his name to Noritomo.
In 1719, he changed his name to Noritomo.
In 1719, he changed his name to Noritomo.

sen.j: 享保9年（1724年）に羽林家最高位の権大納言に就任。
sen.e: In 1724, he was appointed as Gon Dainagon, which was the highest position the members of the House of Urin (one of ranks of noble households) could reach.
In 1724, he was appointed Gon Dainagon, the highest position members of the House of Urin (one of the ranks of noble households) could reach.
In 1724, he was appointed Gon Dainagon, the highest position members of the House of Urin (one of the ranks of noble households) could reach.

sen.j: 享保10年（1725年）には正二位となった。
sen.e: In 1725, he was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
In 1725, he was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank).
In 1725, he was conferred Shonii (Senior Second Rank).

sen.j: 次男を実父千種有維、三男を植松雅孝（正三位宮内卿）の養子に入れている。
sen.e: He adopted his second son to his biological father, Arikore CHIGUSA, and adopted his third son to Masataka UEMATSU (Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household).
His biological father adopted his second son, Arikore CHIGUSA, and Masataka UEMATSU (Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) Kunaikyo (Minister of the Sovereign's Household) adopted his third son.
His biological father, Arikore CHIGUSA, adopted his second son, and Masataka UEMATSU (Shosanmi [Senior Third Rank], Kunaikyo [Minister of the Sovereign's Household]) adopted his third son.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を修正しました。
